rationales.conformity: Followed hospital protocol despite wanting to help Mr. Hernandez directly: 'But I didn't. Followed protocol. Gave him the paperwork.'
rationales.tradition: Invokes abuela's example of doing things 'the right way': 'My abuela used to say you earn respect by doing things the right way, even when the right way is hard.'
rationales.universalism: Shows deep concern for broader welfare and systemic injustice: 'He's 68, worked construction his whole life, and now he can't afford pills that cost the hospital pennies. I went into nursing because I wanted to help people.'

rationales.conformity: Deliberately avoiding family expectations rather than meeting them: 'I come back feeling like I'm failing at being who they expect me to be.'
rationales.tradition: Avoiding church and traditional family gatherings: 'asking when I'm getting married, why I'm not going to church anymore.'
rationales.benevolence: Chose to avoid family rather than maintain close relationships: 'part of me wanted an excuse' to skip Christmas with family.

rationales.tradition: Connected through cultural and religious practice, praying in Spanish with patient: 'She grabbed my hand during the IV and prayed. I prayed with her, quietly, in Spanish. Felt right.'
rationales.benevolence: Went beyond nursing duties to comfort a frightened patient: 'I know enough from my own abuela to say the important things: you're safe, we're going to help you.'
rationales.universalism: Provided dignity to someone from a marginalized community: 'Said they'd never been treated with such dignity at a hospital before.'

rationales.tradition: Missing Christmas for three consecutive years, breaking from family tradition: 'Three years of sending gifts instead of being there. Three years of video calls while everyone eats together.'
rationales.benevolence: Becoming a stranger to close family, especially young cousin: 'My little cousin is seven now and she barely knows who I am. Last year she asked my mom if I was the one who sends the presents.'
Provided comfort to dying stranger in his final moments: 'I held his hand at the end because no one should die alone.'
rationales.universalism: Applied universal principle of human dignity: 'no one should die alone' - extended care beyond personal connection or duty.

rationales.self_direction: Chose to forge her own path despite cultural expectations: 'I don't know if I'm brave for building something new or just selfish for leaving everything behind.'
rationales.tradition: Explicitly rejected expected life path of marriage, family proximity, and religious practice: 'Married by now, probably. Living close to home, seeing my family every Sunday, raising kids who speak Spanish... That's what my mom did, what her mom did.'
rationales.benevolence: Acknowledges leaving family behind and being alone: 'I'm alone in an apartment eating someone else's cooking' while family traditions continue without her.
